intro: Scorzonera tadshikorum, commonly known as the Tadshik Tibetan scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flower heads. The plant produces a taproot that is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to cold climates. Scorzonera tadshikorum is valued for its resilience and ecological significance in its native habitat.
